author: Moira McCarthy
title: Get Back to Nature at Woodstock Inn & Resort | The Herald Traveler |
text:
Love the earth under your fingernails? Then check this out: The Woodstock Inn & Resort invites guests to explore the art and techniques of gardening at its flourishing 2.5 acre Kelly Way Gardens, certified organic by the Vermont Organic Farmers Association.
Master Gardener Benjamin Pauly has nurtured more than 200 varieties of vegetables, 50 types of herbs and edible flowers, 75 berries and orchard plantings, a mushroom glen, and both annual and perennial flowers. Produce from the Kelly Way Gardens provide culinary inspiration for the daily menus at the resort’s two restaurants, the Red Rooster and Richardson’s Tavern.
Garden classes for guests are scheduled Wednesday through Saturday from 10:00 am to 11:00 am, and cover topics such as floral arranging, organic gardening fundamentals and seasonal gardening techniques. The Kitchen Garden Collaborative session on Saturdays shares a behind-the-scenes look at the partnership between the kitchen and gardener, and gives insight into how the current harvests make it on the menu and to the restaurant’s tables. Classes cost $15 per person and include a take home item. A full list of classes can be found here: www.woodstockinn.com/resort/packages/kitchen-garden-package .
The resort also offers an overnight Kitchen Garden Package, available through Sept. 12. Package details include:
One night luxury accommodations
Seasonal bouquet from the garden
Breakfast for two
A tour of the Kelly Way Gardens
Horticulture activity and educational session (Wednesday-Saturday 10:00-11:00 am)
Take home items specific to the horticultural emphasis
Rates start at $347 per night based on double occupancy
As guests attend the garden classes on the morning following their overnight stay, reservations must include at least one Tuesday through Friday night. Guests with multiple nights booked may attend the class each morning. Visitors who did not purchase the package may join a class on a space available basis by registering at the front desk or concierge before attending.
New this summer, Woodstock Inn & Resort adds falconry to its roster of signature outdoor experiences in partnership with the renowned New England Falconry. Located nearby in the resort’s historic 10,000 square foot Rutherford Barn surrounded by a 50 acre meadow, New England Falconry at Woodstock Inn & Resort offers guests opportunities to get “up close and personal” with the fascinating birds of prey. The New England Falconry staff, skilled in the ancient sport of kings, will conduct introductory and extended flying and handling sessions, sharing the history of falconry, raptor adaptations and conservation. Prices start at $50 for observers and $95 for participants. For additional information, visit: http://www.woodstockinn.com/resort/recreation
